results.title: Designing for the disabled
results.brief_description: Some of the problems of wheelchair manoeuvrability are described and the feelings of loneliness, idiosyncrasy and social isolation that many disabled drivers have. Analyses the “real-world problem situation” and identifies problem elements.
results.description: Some of the problems of wheelchair manoeuvrability are described and the feelings of loneliness, idiosyncrasy and social isolation that many disabled drivers have. Analyses the “real-world problem situation” and identifies problem elements.

results.title: Designing a set
results.creator_credit: Betty Edmonds, Robert Edmonds and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: A glimpse of the various stages of set designing for theatre productions. Beginning with rough sketches from a conference involving the designer, director, technicians and gaffers and concluding with the completion of a set. Shows some of the problems encountered during the process, stressing the need for collaboration between the director and working crew. Two set are developed, an interior and an exterior. Produced in co-operation with Dr. Maurice Gnesin, director of the Goodman Memorial Theatre.

results.title: Designing a curriculum
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the idea that our education should not stop with the end of formal studies. Courses are designed to allow students to develop a balanced background in subject undertaken so that they can think creatively and flexibly about work.

results.title: Designer children
results.creator_credit: Paula S. Apsell, Cynthia Page, Larkin McPhee, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Cracking the code”.
Geneticists can now offer a cure for some of the thousands of inherited diseases. This program explores the difficult personal, moral and ethical issues arising from this situation.

results.title: Designed in Britain
results.creator_credit: J.B. Napier-Bell, Leon Clore and Basic Films
results.brief_description: An impression of British design ranging from furniture, textiles, kitchenware and fine china to buildings and towns. Skilfully edited with minimal commentary and a complementary 50’s soundtrack. Music by Ken Moule; photography by Larry Pizer; edited by Derek York.

results.title: Designed for success: programmed for what?
results.creator_credit: Peter Engebretsen, Scottcom, Bank of New South Wales and CES
results.brief_description: Through the eyes of a teenager, explores some of the personal considerations involved in finding a job. Entertaining approach to a difficult question using good clever dialogue and innovative visuals. Cast includes Michael Smith, Basil Clarke, Anne Lambert, Peter Colville, David Wood, Des Mangan.

results.title: Designed for living
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Presents Canada’s accomplishments in industrial design, and the National Industrial Design Council’s encouragement of good design for contemporary living by illustrating a wide selection of household articles. The film defines good design, providing a yardstick for the consumer to use in assessing the merits of manufactured goods, ranging from kitchen utensils to living room furniture. Written by Lois Edwards; photography by John Spotton; editing by Dennis Sawyer; music by Eldon Rathburn; Voice and Narration by Maude Ferguson.

results.title: Design with paper
results.brief_description: Basic instruction designed to stimulate creative experimentation and to explore fundamental principles with simple, basic folds using paper. These designs advance to more complex three dimensional forms which are made possible buy measuring, scoring, folding and pasting.

holdings.name: VHS, Audio Cassette, Text; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: Design of American public education
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and United Productions of America
results.brief_description: Describes the organisational structure of a centrally controlled public education system and the decentralised system under state supervision. Points out that a basic objective of American public education is the advancement of an individualised system intended to produce students capable of assuming an adult role in society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: McGraw-Hill Films and United Productions of America
